summary: This document is an email chain between legal or investigative personnel discussing the coordination and verification of data deliveries (hard drives) from the FBI to the SDNY (Southern District of New York) in the case of US v. Epstein. It focuses on tracking specific NYC-numbered items, checking for duplicates, and handling supplemental information.

events.title: Data provided to SDNY
events.description: The FBI provided data to the Southern District of New York, as referenced in a spreadsheet tracking NYC-numbered items.

keyFacts: The email chain is about verifying data transfers from the FBI to SDNY prosecutors in US v. Epstein.
Specific NYC-numbered evidence items (e.g., NYC024328, NYC024366, NYC024392) are discussed, with concerns about duplicates and supplemental data.
The correspondence indicates meticulous tracking of evidence discovery and data management between agencies.
